content.user_title: Build Godot 4 systems with GDScript patterns
content.value_statement: You need reliable patterns for Godot gameplay systems. This skill provides proven GDScript structures and performance guidance.
actual_capabilities: Explain Godot node, scene, resource, and signal architecture
Provide GDScript state machine and state base class patterns
Outline autoload singletons and global event bus usage
Describe resource based data models for stats and weapons
Show object pooling and pooled actor lifecycles
Guide scene loading, transitions, and save system flow
limitations: Focused on Godot 4.x GDScript patterns only
Does not generate full game projects or assets
Does not cover engine installation or build pipelines
Encryption key management is only shown as an example

prompt_templates.title: Save system design
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a save and load system for player stats and position using resources.

output_examples.input: Give me a scene management approach with loading feedback for Godot 4.
output: Use an autoload scene manager to swap scenes and emit progress signals
Load scenes asynchronously with ResourceLoader threaded requests
Show a loading screen while reporting progress updates
Trigger transition in and out before and after the swap

best_practices: Use signals to decouple scenes and systems
Cache node references for hot paths
Separate data into resources for reuse
anti_patterns: Overusing autoloads for non global features

faq.question: Is this compatible with Godot 4.x?
faq.answer: Yes. The patterns target Godot 4.x GDScript APIs.

faq.question: Does it cover multiplayer or networking?
faq.answer: No. It focuses on core gameplay architecture patterns.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing project?
faq.answer: Yes. Adapt the patterns to your current scenes and scripts.

faq.question: Does it access my files or secrets?
faq.answer: No. The skill content is documentation only.

faq.question: What if a pattern does not fit my game?
faq.answer: Start with a small prototype and adjust the pattern to your needs.

faq.question: How does it compare to general Godot docs?
faq.answer: It focuses on reusable patterns rather than API reference details.
